alert.note: Alert for Ballard; Carlisle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 22 at 4:32PM EST until February 22 at 4:45PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CST FOR WESTERN JOHNSON...CARLISLE AND BALLARD COUNTIES... At 331 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Goreville to near Karnak to 7 miles southeast of Bardwell, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lake Of Egypt Area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 2 and 17. Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 40 and 42. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southern Illinois...and western Kentucky. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
